name: none
detail: none

name: Ear
detail: Used for earring display tables at markets.

name: Bone
detail: Keys, fire pokers, and kebabs sticks, everything has its uses.

name: Arm
detail: Useful to bash monsters with at least.

name: Wing
detail: Icarus a guy met in a tavern recently said he is in need of a couple.

name: Tooth
detail: Well they come in all shapes and sizes and are generally sharp.

name: Claw
detail: Can be ground down and added to tea to cure headaches.

name: Rib
detail: The ribs are often fashioned in to grotesque xylophones.

name: Skin/exoskeleton
detail: Used to make armour and clothing for the rich.

name: Leg
detail: Is its worth as much as they say, or are they just pulling your leg.

name: Foot
detail: Hollowed out and lined with duck feathers, they make great slippers.

name: Hand/paw
detail: A spare hand is always helpful.

name: Blood
detail: Used as an aphrodisiac by the weird and witches.

name: Head
detail: The skull is often hollowed out for ashtrays or trinket boxes.

name: Lung
detail: Swallowed raw its meant to aid breathing.

name: Kidney
detail: Used by some of the occults, or added to pies.

name: Saliva/venom
detail: A vial earns a fair price at the “Annual Mystics Convention“.

name: Eye
detail: Preserving the eye in a jar of vinegar that you carry for just the occasion.

name: Heart
detail: Highly sought after by ambitious wizards to further their studies.

name: Brain
detail: Many believe eating the brain will enhance intelligence, duh!

name: Uncommon
detail: Roll again and record your find on your adventure sheet with “Uncommon” before its name and add +100gp to its value. If you happen to roll Uncommon on the second roll, roll again. +100gp

name: Scarce
detail: Roll again and record your find on your adventure sheet with “Scarce” before its name and add +200gp to its value. If you happen to roll Uncommon, or Scarce on the second roll, roll again.

name: Rare
detail: Roll again and record your find on your adventure sheet with “Rare” before its name and add +400gp’s to its value. If you happen to roll Uncommon, Scarce, or Rare on the second roll, roll again.
